item.title: Marielle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man is a marvelous curiosity … he thinks he is the Creator’s pet … he even believes the Creator loves him; has a passion for him; sits up nights to admire him; yes and watch over him and keep him out of trouble. He prays to him and thinks He listens. Isn't it a quaint idea?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "Creationists make it sound as though a 'theory' is something you dreamt up after being drunk all night." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Plato
item.description: "So where it is a general rule that it is wrong to gratify lovers, this can be attributed to the defects of those who make that rule: the government's lust for rule and the subjects' cowardice" -- Plato

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I have no purpose, directly or indirectly, to interfere with the institution of slavery in the States where it exists. I believe I have no lawful right to do so, and I have no inclination to do so." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If by the mere force of numbers a majority should deprive a minority of any clearly written constitutional right, it might in a moral point of view justify revolution; certainly would if such right were a vital one. But such is not our case." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret to getting ahead is getting started." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "[o]f course like every other man of intelligence and education I do believe in organic evolution. It surprises me that at this late date such questions should be raised." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Marielle add a quote by Richard Feynman
item.description: "The female mind is capable of understanding analytic geometry... The difficulty may just be that we have never yet discovered a way to communicate with the female mind. If it is done in the right way, you may be able to get something out of it." -- Richard Feynman
